title: Change in angular momentum of a wheel

content.prompt: The wheel on a vehicle has a rotational inertia of 2.0 kg⋅m<sup>2</sup>. At the instant the wheel has a counterclockwise angular velocity of 6.0 rad/s, an average counterclockwise torque of 5.0 N⋅m is applied, and continues for 4.0 s. What is the <u>change</u> in angular momentum of the wheel?

unit.text: 6: Energy and Momentum of Rotating Systems

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
